title: Radio-Frequency Energy Harvesting Using Rapid 3D Plastronics Protoyping Approach: A Case Study
text: This project showcases the design of RF energy harvesting using resin polymer as a substrate. The collected data were analyzed in MATLAB through several written scripts. It also demonstrates the use of Agile methodology in teamwork, with each author making individual contributions.

title: Evaluation of Polylactic Acid Polymer as a Substrate in Rectenna for Ambient Radiofrequency Energy Harvesting
text: This project showcases the design of RF energy harvesting using PLA polymer as a substrate. The collected data were analyzed in MATLAB through several written scripts, demonstrating a logical and critical thinking approach to conducting scientific research.

title: Evaluation of Recycled Cardboard Paper as an Eco-Friendly Substrate for Rectenna and Ambient Radio Frequency Energy Harvesting Application
text: This project showcases the design of RF energy harvesting using recycled cardboard as a substrate. The collected data were analyzed in Python and MATLAB through several custom scripts. An analytical and critical thinking approach was employed throughout the teamwork process.

title: Optimal Value of Rectifier Input Impedance in a Rectenna for Radio-Frequency Energy Harvesting
text: This publication demonstrates the importance of input impedance in designing RF energy harvesting circuits. It showcases a critical and logical approach to solving scientific problems.
